result.title: The Hartford: An Insurer I Remain Bullish On, As Its Business Insurance Niche Grows
result.text: The Hartford Insurance Group (HIG) continues to get a buy rating from me, in my latest followup, where I agree with the bullish consensus. It has shown growth in its business insurance segment, resilience after the wildfire events last winter, and improvement to net inflows at its funds business, Hartford Funds. It is also a proven dividend grower over 10 years, with strong investment-grade credit grades from 3 agencies.

result.title: Hartford Insurance: Healthy Margins, Valuation Still Reasonable
result.text: Hartford Insurance stands out as a top-tier U.S. multiline insurer with strong financials, robust margins, and reasonable valuation. HIG's Q2 2025 results highlight 8% premium growth, improving combined ratios, and a 17% core earnings ROE, reflecting operational strength across segments. Despite trading at a discount to peers, the company delivers above-average profitability, double-digit EPS growth, and strong stock performance with low volatility.

result.title: Hartford Insurance: A Buy With Its Small Business Focus And Sound Capital Allocation
result.text: The Hartford Insurance Group remains a compelling investment, considering its Small Business segment's growth and a disciplined capital management strategy. HIG's expansion in small business insurance is supported by AI-driven automation and new cyber offerings, which points to a long runway ahead. The firm's capital allocation policies are sensible, taking into account its cautious approach towards M&As, and steady repurchases and dividends.

result.title: The Hartford Expands Cyber Insurance to Safeguard Small Businesses
result.text: HIG expands cyber coverage via ICON, boosting access for small businesses while posting strong Q2 growth.

result.title: The Hartford Bolsters Cyber Insurance for Small Businesses
result.text: HARTFORD, Conn.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--The Hartford's comprehensive cyber product, CyberChoice First Response, is now available nationwide (excluding Alaska, Louisiana and Vermont) for small businesses through ICON, the company's industry-leading quoting and binding system. Agents and brokers can quickly quote and bind tailored cyber coverage for their small business customers alongside other coverages through an easy, streamlined process.
